text:
“Hand it over,” he said roughly.

The old woman fumbled for her keys. 

She disappeared behind the curtain. 

He listened, thinking.

“She must unlock the top drawer,” he reflected. 

The old woman returned. 

“Here, sir. Thirty-five copecks total. A rouble and fifteen copecks for the watch.” 

“What? Only a rouble and fifteen copecks?” 

“Just so.” 

He took the money, studying her. 

He lingered, wanting to say more.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man reluctantly pawns his watch to the old woman, contemplating her possessions and the degrading nature of the transaction.
